comments.commentBody: Looks like all the GOP cowards in Washington are taking Mr. Walker's advice. It's too hard for Republican Congressmen to deal with sick people, poor people, the air and water we all share, the public schools and colleges that educate all our workers. Make the states do it. Oh, and make THEM raise THEIR taxes because Washington Republicans are too cowardly to tell their gazillionaire cronies and donors to pay a few more dollars. States have to balance their budgets so it's either cut services and programs or raise taxes. And when a state, city, county or school district doesn't have much of tax base, raising taxes is a non-starter, so they just circle the drain. Or beg Congress for grants to save them. Republican governors no less than Democrats are always making trips to Washington to get some pork for their barrels back home. I'm sure Governor Walker has been among them.

I voted against you in every election, even while you were a county executive. This article only reinforces that those votes were rightly cast. Helping those in need has not been something you really cared about, which is the reason you're a terrible governor.

Oh give me a break. Governor Walker, you have never "taken the high road" on anything.
As for the "choice" Americans made in November? We chose Hillary Clinton. The electoral college win of Donald Trump can never change that, so please stop saying he was chosen.
Richard, I am at a loss for words. I actually agree with the entirety of your post. Well said!

Agree with Gov. Walker.  The elites should defy the citizenry.  When stupid citizens shut up, bow down and allow the rich to keep all of the capital, only then will we all be free, like in Guatemala and Bangladesh. Oh, and Russia,

"Where do you want your dollar going? To your local school or to Washington?"

More and more, either would be fine. What bothers me is my dollar going to red states that get the money via Washington, and then turn around to complain about how evil are Washington and the elite liberal blue states that are sending them their money.

Looks like the NYTimes readers are not buying it Scotty. Wisconsin has given the nation Paul Ryan, Scott Walker, and Reince Priebus and not one good idea has come from any of them. What ever happened to people like Bill Proxmire and Les Aspin. I apologize to the nation for Wisconsin's recent swamp creatures.

Scott walker, tool of the rich and greedy sent out to take all he can grab from the middle class and poor at the behest of his rich donors. You are a disgrace to America like the rest of the Republican Party. Let's all hope by next year at this time we will see many of your party out of office and maybe even convicted of treason.
Sorry I can't take seriously an article written by Scott Walker whose term as Wisconsin governor was purchased by the Koch Brothers

So all the protesters are liberals who don't pay taxes? It couldn't be that people are not happy with the Republican platform right now? I disagree with everything you people (from the President on down in your party) want to do right now. I think you are cocky snotty authoritarians with lead ears. Nobody in your party could give a crackerjacks prize about any the people your supposed to serve, outside of the ones who cut the big checks. By the way, everyone from FOX news on down to you can take that liberal/conservative narrative and shove it somewhere else. I am tired of being put on one side or the other because it serves your purposes. I am getting ready to lose my healthcare and Ryan's solution is to cut me a small check? The President tweeted that the press is the enemy of the people and you want us to keep our mouths shut? Go to hell Governor.

Mr. Walker, let's make something very clear here - the "people" really did not speak last November and select Donald Trump.  The "people" selected Hillary Clinton by an almost three million margin.  Due to our constitutional arrangement, the Electoral College chose Donald Trump.  So while you and your fellow Republicans should certainly bask in that victory, please do not claim to have a mandate from the "people."  You do not.

Gov. Walker Proposes Eliminating Labor, Judicial, Education Oversight Commissions
February 13, 2017

http://www.wpr.org/gov-walker-proposes-eliminating-labor-judicial-educat...

Walker, the Wisconsin Legislature and State Supreme Court are corrupt to the core.

Dear Governor Walker,
I'm all in favor of giving back to the States. Give us back a large chunk of our Federal tax dollars that are used to subsidize states like yours!
Respectfully,
A liberal New Yorker
Today's Republican party is all about lies, deceit, misinformation and hypocrisy. You exemplify this well, Mr. Walker.

Unbelievable. Here is a man who claims to believe in democracy saying that a president who was elected with the votes of 27% of registered voters should ignore those who disagree with him. Doesn't sound like democracy to me. It boggles the mind and frightens me....

I love the phrase, "congressional Republicans ... show the courage of their convictions." "Courageous Republican" surely must be the oxymoron of the 21st Century. Who is the alpha brave here: Paul Ryan, Donald Trump, Scott Walker? Truly, this commentary comes from the alternative universe of fantastical thinking.

www.endthemadnessnow.org

Mr. Walker, a man whose campaigns were heavily subsidized by large corporations, preaches that with less unions, less regulation, the country will be a better place-- stand tall, and take it all apart. What he doesn't say, and what he doesn't see, is that some markets need some regulation, that referees are needed in football games, that some things, like safe food, and drinkable water, and bank regulations, and healthcare, are best served when there is a national standard.
When you take away all the rules, there is a rush of money, a brief spike in productivity. But if you leave a large corporation the freedom to maximize quarterly returns, the "common folk" and the "common wisdom", and the obvious community standards, those very standards that he and the free marketers claim will be self correcting-- ARE NOT THERE.
Let me correct the headline: Against Taxpayers, Republicans Must Stand Strong.
Scott Walker is the reason I joined the union.
good thinking article, how to make the next 4 years work.

This man is a liar and a failed Governor. The American people did NOT vote for the Republican agenda. Aside from losing the popular vote, in every instance where the Republican agenda was on the ballot (the minimum wage, gun control, legalizing marijuana), the Republican position lost.

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Swift and everlasting joy on all your journeys....you have given us all life! God bless!

Amy, Years  ago I picked up your "encyclopedia" and loved every word. After many moves over the next few years, most of my hardcover books ended up in boxes in my garage. Yesterday, inexplicably, one of the boxes toppled over and left its contents on the floor. When I bent to pick them up, your book was at the top of the pile. I was so pleased to see it -– it felt like reuniting with an old friend.  However, the incident took on more meaning when I saw this beautiful essay. It was as if finding your book so serendipitously in my garage was a reminder to think of you and remember your talent. I am and I will. Godspeed to you.

Dealing with N.Korea requires a steady hand and an ability to absorb complex relationships. Rash decisions will not work but well thought out ones might.
Trump is basically a "show President" and I am not convinced in any way that he has the intelligence to deal with this situation. Complexity seems to allude him and his constant simplistic approach via Twitter is disturbing. When we have one of the contestant from Dancing with the Stars as the head of the Energy Department one must give great pause as to whether we have the right individuals in place to combat N. Korea.

Dr.--Absolutely right!  A well placed, requested, Russian cyber attack, coupled with unfounded, no protocol, accusations from the FBI, and the repetition of the words "Crooked Hillary," and "Lock Her Up," while avoiding any policy pronouncements that would highlight his ignorance about everything, for month after month, show an abundance of "campaign strategy."

"When we have one of the contestant from Dancing with the Stars as the head of the Energy Department one must give great pause as to whether we have the right individuals in place to combat N. Korea."

Given the pathetic results of Obama’s administration in dealing with North Korea over the last eight years one might suspect that his department heads were too busy watching Dancing with the Stars with some Keeping up with the Kardashians thrown in to "combat N. Korea"
Den:  Did you mean elude?
Except "the Pres" won't consider this sad.
